--- Mattias Fagerlund <mattias@...>
wrote:
> Ken, fellow NEATers; I'm glad to announce my webpage
> featuring 
> DelphiNEAT, located at
> http://www.cambrianlabs.com/mattias/DelphiNEAT/
> 
> If you have _any_ comments or questions, I'd be more
> than happy to hear 

I am very impressed!  The graphics are quite valuable,
in my opinion.  I would like to add graphics to some
of my own projects; I'm currently seeking a
collaborator to take on that responsibility.

Some of those applications are new, right?  Like for
example the "Obstacle Navigator".  I have not seen
that before.  I think that's a very interesting
application.

Here is a suggested extension of the "Obstacle
Navigator" problem which would require the ANN to make
active use of memory:  When the navigator gets to the
end of the path it is required to return to the
starting point.  The fitness is reduced by the time or
number of steps taken to return, hence the ANN needs
to be able to remember the way back and not have to
feel its way.  Basically, the robot navigator feels
its way out, but then returns much more quickly by
remembering the path and following its memory model.
I think this is a challenge that NEAT would be capable
of, and it will be an impressive feat (A NEAT FEAT).

Animals do that all the time, of course.

=====
Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
